title: Citation
text:
Citation
To cite package ‘testingpackage’ in publications use:

Allen J (????). testingpackage: Testing package to pull in data from AWS. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/joshuafayallen/testingpackage.

title: testingpackage

validate_inputs(write_to_directory, path, country, file_name, write_function)

title: testingpackage

validate_inputs(write_to_directory, path, country, file_name, write_function)

title: testingpackage
text:
This function imports our data from an s3 AWS bucket



import_palmer_penguins(
  write_to_directory = FALSE,
  path = NULL,
  country = NULL,
  file_name = NULL,
  write_function = NULL,
  partions = NULL
)







write_to_directory


controls whether data is written to local directory. Defaults to FALSE




path


name of directory you would like to write the dataset to




country


If you want a subset of the data please provide a string for something coercible to a string.




file_name


when write_directory is TRUE please specify a file name. Must be a character




write_function


a function to write the data. can be write.csv or arrow::write_parquet. If no function supplied than we will try to guess the function




partions


if write_to_directory is set to TRUE asnd file_type is parquet this will control the partions. Can be character vector or unquoted column names. Defaults to null






This function returns a tibble or Arrow Dataset containing the data

title: testingpackage
text:
This is a testing package for a future data package. Stay tuned for a cool package in the future. The main functionality is reading data from S3 buckets and github releases. This is really just a wrapper around some other fantastic packages. To install this package you can run.

devtools::install_github('joshuafayallen/testingpackage')
